ref: 11289 *vaptra ʻ sowing, seed land ʼ. [Cf. vaptr̥ -- m. ʻ sower ʼ Mn., uptrima -- ʻ sown, cultivated ʼ Pāṇ.com. -- √vap2]
S. vaṭraṇu ʻ to moisten (by sprinkling or flooding) ʼ, vaṭra f. ʻ moistening of ground, first fruits ʼ;
L. vattar m. ʻ moist state of land ʼ, vattrī f. ʻ moisture ʼ,
awāṇ. vatur ʻ proper moisture of land for working ʼ;
P. vattar ʻ fit for sowing (of ground not too wet after being soaked) ʼ, vattar, ba˚, vatt, ba˚ f. ʻ moistening land sufficiently for ploughing ʼ, vattā ʻ moist ʼ;
bhal. baṭḷ ʻ moist ʼ, dhuṛ -- baṭḷ m. ʻ scarcity of moisture in soil (i.e. sowing in dust) ʼ.
bhal. baṭḷ ʻ moist ʼ, dhuṛ -- baṭḷ m. ʻ scarcity of moisture in soil (i.e. sowing in dust) ʼ.
